main event: A person named Walter Giesler reported seeing three bright, unconventional objects in the sky traveling in a westerly direction at a very high rate of speed near Fairmont, West Virginia on October 22, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were completely silent and much brighter than the surrounding stars or planets.
The objects appeared to be at a very high altitude, possibly in the vicinity of 30,000 to 40,000 feet.
The objects did not blink or flash, but emitted a steady, brilliant glow.
The objects suddenly made a turn towards the south and disappeared from sight almost immediately.
The police had already received several similar reports from other citizens in the Fairmont area.
sighted object: three bright, unconventional objects in the sky
